Jan Algermissen wrote:
> Noah,
>
> hmm - what is your point exactly?
>
> On Jan 16, 2010, at 11:49 PM, Noah Campbell wrote:
>
>   
>> I know, right!?!
>>
>> Now, allowing intermediaries to break the opaqueness isn't a bad thing
>>     
>
> Why do you think it is not a bad thing to introduce coupling between  
> servers and intermediaries around the URI structure? Once you do that,  
> the server looses control over its URI space.
>
>   

Some types of reverse proxy mechanisms need to be configured against URI 
patterns though, no?

- Mike
